bio:treatment.description: Plants growing singly or in loose, scattered clumps. Leaves 3–9, erect, (2–)3–6.7 dm × 0.8–3.2 cm; blade liguliform, not glaucous, or slightly glaucous to deep shiny green. Tepals no longer than 13 cm.
cypress drainages and stringers associated with wet pine flatwoods

verbatim.text: Flowering late spring. Cypress drainages and stringers associated with wet pine flatwoods; of conservation concern; 0 m; Fla.

parsed.habitat: Cypress drainages and stringers associated with wet pine flatwoods;

bio:treatment.discussion: Hymenocallis henryae var. henryae is only found in Bay, Gulf, and Walton counties.
